entry.title: CollegeBoard Big Idea 1.3 Notes and Quiz

link.title: CollegeBoard Big Idea 1.3 Notes and Quiz

entry.summary: CollegeBoard Unit: Program Design and Development There is a lot of development that has to go into programs to make the user interactions easier. CRD - 2.E.1 says that a development process can be ordered and intentional or exploratory in nature. CRD 2.E.2 says that there are multiple development processes. the following phases are commonly used when developing a program: investigating and reflecting, designing, prototyping, and testing. CRD 2.F.3 also says that some ways investigation can be performed are with collecting data through surveys, user testing, interviews, and direct observations.

entry.title: Customizing my Python Flask
entry.summary: Changing and Customizing my own Python Flask Home Page I went to the index.html file and I was able to learn what each code was doing and I saw that you could code a card and I decided to add another code under the heading About Me. I also went in to the headings and changed them to make them more about me and show what I wanted to focus on.

author.name: Edwin Abraham, Emaad Mir, Jishnu Singiresu, and Luka Van Den Boomen

entry.title: CollegeBoard Big Idea 1.2 Notes and Quiz

link.title: CollegeBoard Big Idea 1.2 Notes and Quiz

entry.summary: CollegeBoard Unit: Program Function and Purpose All Computer Innovations are built for a purpose. CRD - 2.A.1 says that the purpose of computing innovations is to solve problems or to pursue interests through creative expression. CRD - 2.A.2 is an understanding of the purpose of a computing innovations provides developers with an improved ability to develop that computing innovation. CRD - 2.C.1 says that program inputs are data sent to a computer for processing by a program. Input can come in a variety of forms, such as tactile, audio, visual, or text. CRD - 2.D.1 says that program outputs are any data sent from a program to a device. Program output can come in a variety of forms, such as tactile, audio, visual, or text. Also, CRD - 2.B.1 says that a program is a collection of program statements that perform s a specific task when run by a computer. A program is often referred to as software.
